description: Analyze the existing CLI structure to determine where to add the new option for the terminal monitor.
instructions: Open and examine the files `src/ai_whisperer/cli.py`, `src/ai_whisperer/commands.py`, and `src/ai_whisperer/main.py`.
Locate the command definition responsible for initiating the plan execution process. This is likely within `src/ai_whisperer/cli.py` or `src/ai_whisperer/commands.py`.
Analyze the existing argument parsing structure (likely using `click` or similar library) to identify the most appropriate place to add a new boolean option.
Consider potential names for the option, such as `--monitor`, `--show-monitor`, or `--enable-terminal-monitor`, and choose one that is clear and consistent with existing options.

Determine how this new boolean option's value will be accessed and propagated through the application layers, specifically how it will reach the execution engine (`src/ai_whisperer/execution_engine.py`) or the AI loop (`src/ai_whisperer/ai_loop.py`) where the monitoring logic will likely reside.

Document your analysis, including the identified command, the proposed option name and its location in the CLI definition, and the planned method for passing the option's value to the relevant execution components.
Write these findings and the proposed integration point into the file `docs/cli_analysis_monitor_option.md`.
constraints: The analysis must be based solely on the provided input files.
The output document must be in Markdown format.
validation_criteria: The content of `docs/cli_analysis_monitor_option.md` must clearly identify the specific CLI command that needs to be modified.
The document must propose a specific name for the new boolean CLI option (e.g., `--monitor`).
The document must specify the proposed location within the CLI definition where this new option should be added.
The document must include a description of how the value of the new CLI option will be passed to the execution engine or AI loop.
name: analyze_cli_structure
